container.description: The message (e.g. article) containing the blocks that are being rendered. This is used by some block renderers when it needs data from the container or to generate urls.

platform.description: The platform the blocks are being rendered into, e.g. web, amp, apple-news, facebook-instant-articles.

section.description: Refers to the location on the screen or application that the blocks are being rendered into, e.g. "article-detail", "blogroll", "modal", "jumbotron". Renderers can use this to customize the output.

config.description: A map to store config variables that can be used when rendering blocks, e.g. ad_zone, sponsor.

flags.description: A map to store flags (booleans) that can be used when rendering blocks. These are different from "config" as they will always be booleans, e.g. disable_autoplay, allowfullscreen, dnt (do not track).
